title: Ousmane Dembele could miss El Clasico after telling referee he was 'very bad' against Sevilla
text:
Ousmane Dembele was sent-off by the referee at the end of Barcelona's 4-0 win against Sevilla for saying 'you're very bad', in response to Ronald Araujo's red card.

The referee report confirms that Dembele said 'very bad, you're very bad' to referee Miguel Antonio Mateu Lahoz, while also making a gesture with his arms.

Such is the nature of the sending off for dissent, Dembele could be banned for two matches which would mean missing the El Clasico against Real Madrid at Camp Nou on October 26.

Ousmane Dembele scored in the first-half but received his marching orders after 88 minutes

Dembele was reacting after Araujo, just 14 minutes into his first-team debut, was sent off for a challenge on Javier Hernandez.

Diego Costa received an eight-game ban for his allegedly insulting words last season, but more tamely, Deportivo La Coruna's Michael Krohn-Dehli was given a two-game suspension for saying the same thing as Dembele.

Gabriel Pires and Fabian Orellana have also called the referee 'bad' and received two-game bans.

Ronald Araujo gets tight to Javier Hernandez in the final minutes at the Camp Nou

Dembele had earlier scored at the Nou Camp, netting Barca's third goal in the 35th minute.

Luis Suarez, Arturo Vidal and Lionel Messi were also on the scoresheet as Barca climbed to second in the La Liga table, two points behind Real Madrid.

Their first game after the international break is a trip to Eibar, before they host Real Madrid a week later.
description: The referee report confirms that Dembele said 'very bad, you're very bad', whilst also making a gesture with his arms. Dembele faces a two-game ban meaning he would miss the El Clasico
